intro: Chamaesyce cayensis, commonly known as Cayenne groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. It produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by fluffy, seed-bearing structures. Chamaesyce cayensis is often found in disturbed habitats and is relatively hardy in tropical climates.
